overall.description:
Converts a tuple of index arrays into an array of flat
indices, applying boundary modes to the multi-index.

multi_index.description: A tuple of integer arrays, one array for each dimension.

dims.description: The shape of array into which the indices from multi_index apply.

mode.description: Specifies how out-of-bounds indices are handled.  Can specify either one mode or a tuple of modes, one mode per index.  ‘raise’ – raise an error (default) ‘wrap’ – wrap around ‘clip’ – clip to the range  In ‘clip’ mode, a negative index which would normally wrap will clip to 0 instead.

order.description: Determines whether the multi-index should be viewed as indexing in row-major (C-style) or column-major (Fortran-style) order.

raveled_indices.description: An array of indices into the flattened version of an array of dimensions dims.
